mdRecord.dcterms:title: Whereas the State-Convention in their fifth resolve recommended to the inhabitants of the several towns to keep a watchful eye over each other, that no evasion or infringement of their resolutions may escape notice: Resolved, That we the inhabitants of this town do hereby engage to watch carefully over each other, and persons with whom we have any dealings . /By order of the Select-Men, &c. Danvers, August 26, 1779. ; Archelaus Dale, Chairman, Pro. Temp
Whereas the State Convention in their fifth resolve
mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Albert H. Small Declaration of Independence Collection (University of Virginia)
Dale, Archelaus.
Danvers (Mass.). Selectmen.
Russell, Ezekiel, 1743-1796

mdRecord.dcterms:description: Title from the beginning of the text. Possibly imperfect, with caption title clipped from the top.
"Price 4s. by hundred or dozen. [?] s. single]"

SPECIAL COLLECTIONS: Left edge closely clipped, with slight loss of text. "Timothy Felton of Danvers 1787" written on verso. Albert A. Small Declaration of Independence Collection. Deposit of Albert H. Small, July 14, 2003.
